body:
[P0] Swift `if` expression may break older toolchains

`let assembled = if let user { ... } else { ... }` requires Swift 5.9+ (and may not be enabled in all build environments). If CI/Xcode for `apps/macos` isn’t guaranteed to be on a toolchain that supports `if` expressions, this will fail to compile.

This change is unrelated to the WhatsApp fix, so it’s also a high-risk surprise for this PR.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: apps/macos/Sources/OpenClaw/AppState.swift
Line: 425:429

Comment:
[P0] Swift `if` expression may break older toolchains

`let assembled = if let user { ... } else { ... }` requires Swift 5.9+ (and may not be enabled in all build environments). If CI/Xcode for `apps/macos` isn’t guaranteed to be on a toolchain that supports `if` expressions, this will fail to compile.

This change is unrelated to the WhatsApp fix, so it’s also a high-risk surprise for this PR.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
